planet.name: HD 1461 e
planet.description: A planet candidate in a ~5000-day orbit was announced by Rivera et al. (2010). This planet was not confirmed by follow-up studies, and according to Díaz et al. (2016) the signal may be due to incomplete sampling of the stellar activity cycle. This planet candidate was originally designated HD 1461 d, however due to the use of HD 1461 c for the 13.5-day planet, the Extrasolar Planets Encyclopaedia uses the designation HD 1461 e to refer to this planet.
